Technique: FORMED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL; ENGOBE; PAINTED
Name: Amphora
Description: Amphora with moulded rim, short neck, wide shoulders and ring-shaped foot. It has two handles starting at the neck and ending at the shoulders, oval in cross-section. The exterior surface is covered with an orangey coating. The upper third presents a zoomorphic decoration: above a double band of a reddish colour crocodiles appear, facing right. One of them is almost completely preserved and of the second one we can still see the posterior.
